intro: Calcitrapa carneola, commonly known as the red sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically succulent and adapted to arid conditions, reflecting its preference for dry, well-drained soils. Calcitrapa carneola is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
